body:
### Neovim version (nvim -v)

v0.7.0-dev

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

.

### Operating system/version

NixOS 22.05

### Terminal name/version

alacritty 0.10.1

### $TERM environment variable

alacritty

### Installation

from source

### How to reproduce the issue

I'm not sure if this is a bug or I'm doing something wrong, but if a have a floating window placed relative to another floating window it seems to lag behind by 1 event when I `nvim_win_set_config`.

A demo is probably worth a thousand words, so here it is. Run `nvim --clean -u ./init.lua` with the following `init.lua`

```lua
local api = vim.api

local bufnr1 = api.nvim_create_buf(false, true)
local bufnr2 = api.nvim_create_buf(false, true)

local winid1, winid2

local opts1 = {
  relative = "cursor",
  row = 1,
  col = 0,
  width = 10,
  height = 5,
}

local opts2 = {
  relative = "win",
  win = nil,
  row = 0,
  col = opts1.width + 1,
  width = 10,
  height = 5,
}

local shift_windows = function()
  if winid1 then
    api.nvim_win_set_config(winid1, opts1)
  else
    winid1 = api.nvim_open_win(bufnr1, false, opts1)
  end

  opts2.win = winid1
  if winid2 then
    -- Closing and reopening the second window instead of setting a new config
    -- seems to fix the issue, even tough `opts2` is the exact same table in
    -- both commands.
    --
    -- api.nvim_win_hide(winid2)
    -- winid2 = api.nvim_open_win(bufnr2, false, opts2)

    api.nvim_win_set_config(winid2, opts2)
  else
    winid2 = api.nvim_open_win(bufnr2, false, opts2)
  end

  print(winid1, winid2)
end

local clear_windows = function()
  api.nvim_win_hide(winid1)
  api.nvim_win_hide(winid2)
  winid1 = nil
  winid2 = nil
end

api.nvim_create_autocmd("TextChangedI", { callback = shift_windows })
api.nvim_create_autocmd("InsertLeave", { callback = clear_windows })
```
here I'm creating two floating windows, the first one is relative to the cursor and the second one is relative to the first one. On `TextChangedI`, if they already exist they get shifted with `nvim_win_set_config`, if not they are spawned with `nvim_open_win`. Finally, they are cleared on `InsertLeave`.

I'd expect the two to move in sync, but they don't. Here's what happens

![bad](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59321248/160168951-dfcace13-34ba-4c69-8f0a-33f28be6f3d8.gif)

as you can see, the second window is one column too close when inserting characters, and one column too far when deleting them. I think it's because it's positioning itself relative to where the first floating window used to be, not where it is now.

However, if instead of shifting the second window I close and reopen it every time, then they are in sync.

![good](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59321248/160169675-185d90e7-21a4-44a5-8a11-5e681429e45f.gif)

You can test it by uncommenting
```lua
    api.nvim_win_hide(winid2)
    winid2 = api.nvim_open_win(bufnr2, false, opts2)
```
and commenting
```lua
    -- api.nvim_win_set_config(winid2, opts2)
```
in the code above.

### Expected behavior

The two floats move together.

### Actual behavior

The second one lags behind.
title: Floating window lags behind when setting `relative="win"`
